author: cobblecat
title: Endubis Messenger Wallet
description: Inconvenience while conducting payment with ADA. All existing wallets are not friendly for those new to the crypto space.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal is an interesting idea. The proposer has identified a problem and a solution to the problem that fit the challenge objectives. There is an estimated timeline to deliver a working product that seems to be viable.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposer has given some info about the Telegram bot and its functionality but is unclear who develop it as the GitHub account stated in the proposal doesn't have a repository for this app nor any other to emphasize the proposers' experience in programming (the other repositories are forks from other branches and some workouts for Angular).

Testing the bot on Telegram seems that there is a possibility to send funds in ADA to an address but is unclear who controls that address (the user that sent the funds? the owner of the bot?) thus being e serious threat for the regular users. Transparency would be a big step forward to gain users trust. Thinking for a solution to secure the users funds in the bot's wallet would be a better approach for a successful product.

The proposer has taken into consideration the risk regarding the Telegram API performance but is not aware about the legal constrains (how regulated is, in Ethiopia, the payment system using cryptocurrencies?).

The budget is outlined and broken down into identifiable items. However, is unclear how many developers will split the $5k amount and what Marketing consists of, thus making difficult to estimate if is reasonable or not, to achieve the proposed goals.
f6_assessments.q2:
It is unclear if this projects needs additional funding taking into consideration that it has an extended time frame of operability for 12 months (at least) as the statement about self sustainability, based on staking rewards and loan APY (APR), is just an assumption (a financial analysis is required to make those products attractive both for users and the lenders).
Based on the provided and gathered info there are drawbacks that can lead to an unsuccessful product medium/long term

f6_assessments.q0: My initial reaction to this was "why telegram", but that answer was quickly given by the proposer and it makes sense. Telegram is the single most widely used application in Ethiopia and Cardano should be everywhere it's potential users are. Given the success of WeChat's in app payment, I think it's only natural that we have a Telegram compatible payment system of our own which could potentially onboard tens of thousands of users to Cardano using this real-world use case.
f6_assessments.q1: I think the proposal itself is rather humble and reasonable. In addition, the proposer has already created a small bitcoin telegram bot which proves both web3 and python proficiency, which is what you would need to successfully implement this roadmap.
f6_assessments.q2: The roadmap makes sense, the team appears to be committed to their milestones and KPI reporting so I believe we have enough information pending their updates to successfully audit the relative success of failure of this proposal.

f6_assessments.q0: It is a good idea to use a telegram bot payment system to pay quickly with low fees for small items. I have a question in which country or region can this application be deployed?. Does using telegram lose centralization of blockchain as transaction information can be modified?. The proponent posted this on fund6 and on the solution I have not seen anything outstanding compared to fund 6
f6_assessments.q1: What are the legal issues and risks when integrating with banks and other platforms?, unit price tracking, authentication and payment for small items? (pay in ada or any other coin?) As for the technical solution I can imagine what it would look like, but consider providing a list of functions as the only thing I found is this buy and sell ADA.
f6_assessments.q2: You mentioned staking and lending features so it is difficult to imagine the final solution and its special capabilities related to the limitations of Telegram you mentioned. Regarding the cost provided please try to detail the amount for each specific job to help readers and voters understand what the final solution will look like.

f6_assessments.q0: This could be a really good idea, because a lot of people find all the new technology difficult to keep track of. If this could just be integrated into something they use everyday, it will be so much better for them and easier. This proposal falls within the challenge and will be positive for the Cardano Ecosystem.
f6_assessments.q1: Unfortunately the proposer does not give much detail on the team member/s like how many will be needed and their names with links to education and skills. The milestones are set out well and the budget broken down. The budget is below the Challenge max per proposal of 10 000 USD, as the budget is 8000 USD. The timeline. the challenge states that delivery should take place 3 months from funding, the proposal suggests Beta Testing - Week 8-12. This is ore or less in time. The implementation plan is set out nicely and the risks are discussed briefly only.
f6_assessments.q2: The milestones and  reporting are set out well, but no way is indicated how the community can follow the progress of the project.

solution: An in-message wallet integration for easy payments, storage, and transfer of ADA amongst friends. something like We-chat but even simpler.
experience: An entrepreneur with a background in Software engineering.
